tit.e: "Kamigata Uta" (A Song in "Kamigata" [Kyoto-Osaka Area], Accompanied With "Shamisen" [The Three-Stringed Japanese Banjo])
tit.cmt: タイトルなので" "削除しました。説明訳括弧を削除し、次行に補足しました。

sen.j: 上方歌（かみがたうた）は、「上方唄」とも、「上方端唄（歌）」とも呼ばれる京阪都市部の三味線音楽である。
sen.e: "Kamigata uta" (also called "Kamigata hauta") is the song with shamisen accompaniment, performed and enjoyed in urban areas of Kyoto and Osaka.
"Kamigata uta" (also called "Kamigata hauta") is the songs with shamisen (the three-stringed Japanese banjo) accompaniment, performed and enjoyed in Kamigata (Kyoto-Osaka area).

sen.j: 上方歌は「地歌」の別称としても使われる（特に江戸その他の地域から見ての呼称）。
sen.e: "Kamigata uta" has been used as another name of "jiuta" (a genre of traditional songs accompanied with shamisen), especially in places other than Kamigata, such as "Edo" (Tokyo area).

sen.j: しかし、特に上方舞の世界や関西の一部の地歌箏曲の世界で使われるこの名称がさすものはそれとは少し異なるジャンルの音楽のようである。
sen.e: "Kamigata uta" has also been used in the world of "Kamigata mai" (dances born in the pleasure quarters of Kamigata) and in some parts of the world of "jiuta sokyoku" (songs accompanied with shamisen and "koto" [the long Japanese zither with thirteen strings]), but this "Kamigata uta" seems to be a little different from the above-mentioned "Kamigata uta."

sen.j: 厳密に区別するのは難しいが、地歌の「端歌もの」同様、江戸時代以降花街や民衆の間で流行した。
sen.e: Kamigata uta has been, like hauta mono in jiuta, popular in geisha quarters and in the public from the Edo period, but many Kamigata uta seem to have more rhythmical melody and more cheerful lyrics than hauta mono in jiuta, though it is difficult to make a strict distinction between the two..
